question: 拍子
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>child</kanji> of musical <kanji>beat</kanji>s is the <vocabulary>tempo</vocabulary>. You can only keep <vocabulary>time</vocabulary> if you have a good beat to guide you, like a father.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You haven't learned this reading for <ja>拍</ja> yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You get the <vocabulary>tempo</vocabulary> and the <vocabulary>rhythm</vocabulary> going in your body. You can't help but sing out loud, "<reading>Heyo</reading> (<ja>ひょう</ja>), heyo!" Feel that rhythm and sing with me! HEYO HEYO!
